description.S1: Minister Clarke has asked you to send a message to Earth

blurb.B1: You will obtain this quest when talking to Minister Clarke for the quest The City and the Stars.
blurb.B2: Clarke will ask you to use Rockwell's access to message Earth.
blurb.B3: This unlocks the task: The Lying Earth,
blurb.B4: and gets you a cartridge with details on corruption on mismanagement: Minister Clarke's Data Cartridge.

description.S1: Minister Clarke has a message for the Earth Directorate,
description.S2: and one of the only terminals in Halcyon capable of transmitting to the Earthbound message drone is in the Chairman's office.
description.S3: Go to the HHC building in Byzantium and send his message.

blurb.B1: If you've completed Balance Due you will have access to the HHC building and won't need to use the Maintenance Tunnels.
blurb.B2: You can also skip the tunnels by walking to the front door and bribing the guard for 2000 bits.
blurb.B3: Once inside the HHC building go straight ahead and talk to Guard Bachmayer.
blurb.B4: You'll take a lift heading to Percival Platt -
blurb.B5: he has nothing important to say so go left and unlock the door with Minister's HHC Access Card
blurb.B6: You can print the keycard at the terminal to gain the Ministry of Accuracy and Morale Key.
blurb.B7: You can also send Minister Clarke's message completing the Lying Earth quest and earning you a small amount of Negative Reputation with The Board.

dialog.speaker: MinisterClarke (Male)
dialog.utterance: When you reach the HHC building, this access card should get you up to the executive suites. Where the Chairman's office and what used to be my office are.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Then I'll be on my way.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What used to be your office?

dialog.speaker: MinisterClarke (Male)
dialog.utterance: Wait! Rockwell has one of the only terminals capable of transmitting to the Earthbound message drone. This is our chance.

dialog.speaker: MinisterClarke (Male)
dialog.utterance: Please, take this and transmit it from his office. Rockwell hasn't given me any messages from Earth for years - he's desperate to keep me out of contact with the Earth Directorate.

dialog.speaker: MinisterClarke (Male)
dialog.utterance: But they need to know what's happening here.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What's on the cartridge?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Why are you trusting me to help you?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You can count on me, Minister Clarke.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: No promises.

dialog.speaker: MinisterClarke (Male)
dialog.utterance: What ISN'T on it is the real question!

dialog.speaker: MinisterClarke (Male)
dialog.utterance: I've gathered meeting minutes, internal messages, sustainability reports, and more, all exposing the corruption and mismanagement plaguing Halcyon.

dialog.speaker: MinisterClarke (Male)
dialog.utterance: Once the rest of the Earth Directorate sees it, they'll have to send help.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Good plan.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That's idiotic.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: How long will that take?

dialog.speaker: MinisterClarke (Male)
dialog.utterance: Perhaps there is hope, after all.

dialog.speaker: MinisterClarke (Male)
dialog.utterance: And now I entrust it to you. Good luck, and trust no one in the Acropolis District.

dialog.speaker: MinisterClarke (Male)
dialog.utterance: In the name of the Architect. What hope is there if this is our best chance?

dialog.speaker: MinisterClarke (Male)
dialog.utterance: It's all I can do. Please, won't you at least try?

dialog.speaker: MinisterClarke (Male)
dialog.utterance: Depending on the nature of their response? Months, at least. Perhaps years.

dialog.speaker: MinisterClarke (Male)
dialog.utterance: Organizing and sending personnel all the way out here is no mean feat.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Well, it's something.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: But if it works, it'll be worth it.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: This is a waste of time.

dialog.speaker: MinisterClarke (Male)
dialog.utterance: Why indeed? I know so little about you, much less your motivations...

dialog.speaker: MinisterClarke (Male)
dialog.utterance: But I'm afraid I don't have many options, confined as I am.

dialog.speaker: MinisterClarke (Male)
dialog.utterance: Besides, I've nothing to lose. If you're looking into Rockwell, I can only hope you're also looking out for Halcyon.

dialog.speaker: MinisterClarke (Male)
dialog.utterance: Good. Halcyon is in dire need of someone like you.

dialog.speaker: MinisterClarke (Male)
dialog.utterance: Then I suppose I can only hope. Good luck.

dialog.speaker: MinisterClarke (Male)
dialog.utterance: Oh, I haven't been allowed up there in years. I shudder to think what Rockwell's done with the place.

dialog.speaker: MinisterClarke (Male)
dialog.utterance: A gilded minibar, perhaps? A personal theater? The man has too much money and too little sense.
